intro: Tecoma alba var. subdenudata, commonly known as the white trumpetbush, is a variant of the yellow bell tree native to parts of Africa and the Caribbean. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 3–6 meters. The plant is characterized by its white, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slight pubescence, while its bark is smooth and grayish in color. This plant is adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides.
